citation.article-title: Jiangella alkaliphila sp. nov., an actinobacterium isolated from a cave.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Jiangella alkaliphila sp. nov.

Jiangella alkaliphila (al.kal.i.phil′a. Arabic article al the; Arabic n. qaliy ashes of saltwort; N.L. n. alkali alkali; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. fem. adj. alkaliphila loving alkaline conditions).
Aerobic, Gram-positive, non-acid–alcohol-fast.
Catalase-positive.
Forms well-developed aerial and vegetative mycelia that fragment into short or elongated rods.
Aerial mycelium is white or greyish yellow–brown.
The reverse colour of colonies is variable depending on growth medium.
Mesophilic.
The temperature for growth is in the range 20–37 °C, with good growth at 30 °C.
The initial pH range for growth is 6.1–10.1, with good growth at pH 8.1–10.1.
Growth occurs in the presence of up to 3 % NaCl.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
H2S is not produced.
Gelatin is liquefied.
Casein, DNA, elastin, aesculin and hypoxanthine are degraded, but chitin, starch, dl-tyrosine, urea and xanthine are not.

d-Arabinose, l-arabinose, cellobiose, dextran, d-fructose, d-glucose, inulin, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, d-xylose, adonitol (weak), glycerol and d-mannitol are assimilated as sole carbon and energy sources for growth.

The following carbon sources are not utilized: d-galactose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, raffinose, d-ribose, salicin, l-sorbose, sucrose, trehalose, 2,3-butanediol, myo-erythritol, myo-inositol, 1,2-propanediol, d-sorbitol and d-xylitol.
Assimilation of organic acids (acetate, benzoate, citrate, formate, malate, succinate, dl-tartrate) is not observed.
Cell wall contains ll-DAP as the diagnostic diamino acid and glucose as the major sugar.
The major menaquinone is MK-9(H4).
The phospholipid profile comprises diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylinositol mannoside and an unknown phospholipid.
Mycolic acids are not present.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 (20.4 %), iso-C16 : 0 (18.0 %) and iso-C14 : 0 (8.9 %).
The G+C content of the DNA is 71.5 mol%.
The type strain, D8-87T (=JBRI 2008T=KCTC 19222T=DSM 45079T), was isolated from soil from a natural cave in Jeju, Republic of Korea.
